{{infobox football tournament season | title = Estonian Cup | year = 1938 | other_title = Eesti Karikas | country = [[Estonia]] | champions = [[VS Sport Tallinn]] | nextseason = [[1939 Estonian Cup|1939]] }} The '''1938 Estonian Cup''' ({{lang-et|Eesti Karikas}}) was the '''first''' season of the [[Estonia]]n [[Football (soccer)|football]] knockout tournament. 11 teams took part of the competition. In that time there was no penalty shoot-out after extra time. Because of that another final had to be arranged as the first match ended 1–1. In the second match, played on November 6 in [[Kadrioru Stadium|Kadriorg Stadium]], '''[[SK Sport Tallinn|VS Sport Tallinn]]''' narrowly won over [[Tallinna Jalgpalliklubi]], thus becoming the first cup champions of [[Estonia]]. ==Preliminary round== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150px|Home team !width=60px|Score !width=150px|Away team |- |'''[[PK Olümpia Tartu]]'''||5–1||[[VVS Puhkekodu Tallinn]] |- |'''[[SS Kalev Pärnu]]'''||5–2
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]])||[[Üle Eestilise Noorte Ühenduse Tallinna Osakond|ÜENÜTO]] |- |[[KS Võitleja Narva]]||3–4||'''[[Narva THK]]''' |} ==Quarter-finals== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150px|Home team !width=60px|Score !width=150px|Away team |- |[[SS Kalev Pärnu]]||0–1||'''[[SK Sport Tallinn|VS Sport Tallinn]]''' |- |[[PK Olümpia Tartu]]||0–3||'''[[JK Tervis Pärnu|SS Tervis Pärnu]]''' |- |[[ESS Kalev Tallinn]]||2–3||'''[[Tallinna Jalgpalliklubi]]''' |- |[[Narva THK]]||0–1||'''[[SÜ Esta Tallinn]]''' |} ==Semi-finals== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150px|Home team !width=60px|Score !width=150px|Away team |- |'''[[SK Sport Tallinn|VS Sport Tallinn]]'''||3–2||[[JK Tervis Pärnu|SS Tervis Pärnu]] |- |[[SÜ Esta Tallinn]]||0–1
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]])||'''[[Tallinna Jalgpalliklubi]]''' |} ==Final 1 & 2== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150px|Home team !width=60px|Score !width=150px|Away team |- |[[SK Sport Tallinn|VS Sport Tallinn]]||1–1
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]])||[[Tallinna Jalgpalliklubi]] |- |'''[[SK Sport Tallinn|VS Sport Tallinn]]'''||2–1
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]])||[[Tallinna Jalgpalliklubi]] |} ==References== :[http://www.rsssf.com/tablese/estcuphist.html Estonia Cup Finals], [[RSSSF]] {{reflist}} {{Estonian Cup}} {{Football in Estonia}} {{1937–38 in European football (UEFA)}} {{1938–39 in European Football (UEFA)}} [[Category:1938 in Estonian football|Cup]] [[Category:Estonian Cup]] {{Estonia-footy-competition-stub}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox stadium | stadium_name = Aggie Memorial Stadium | nickname = | image = Aggie Memorial Stadium - West Side Stands & Press Box 01.JPG | location = Stewart St & Payne St, [[Las Cruces, New Mexico|Las Cruces, NM]] 88003 | coordinates = {{coord|32|16|47|N|106|44|28|W|type:landmark|display=it}} | broke_ground = March 1977 | opened = September 16, 1978 | closed = | demolished = | owner = [[New Mexico State University]] | operator = New Mexico State University | surface = Hybrid Bermuda Grass (1978–2013)
[[Artificial turf|UBU Sports Speed S5-M synthetic turf]] (2014–present) | construction_cost = $4 million
(${{formatprice|{{Inflation|US|4000000|1978}}}} in {{Inflation-year|US}} dollars{{inflation-fn|US}}) | architect = Craig Protz of Bohening-Protz Associates;
[[Caudill Rowlett Scott]] of Houston, Consultants | former_names = | tenants = [[New Mexico State Aggies]] ([[NCAA]]) (1978–present) | seating_capacity = 30,343 }} '''Aggie Memorial Stadium''' is an outdoor [[American football|football]] stadium on the campus of [[New Mexico State University]] in [[Las Cruces, New Mexico]]. The stadium is the home field of the FBS independent [[New Mexico State University|New Mexico State]] [[New Mexico State Aggies football|Aggies]]. The venue opened in September 1978 and the current seating capacity is 30,343. The artificial playing field sits at an elevation of 3,980 feet (1,213 m) [[AMSL|above sea level]]. It is the former home of NM State Aggies women's soccer.http://www.nmstatesports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=1900&ATCLID=3748849 ==Prior to 1978== Prior to 1978, the Aggies had played on the same site since 1933. Located just to the northeast of Hadley Hall (the university's Administration building), and originally known as Quesenberry Field, the original Memorial Stadium was built over it in 1950. It was dedicated as a memorial to [[New Mexico State University|New Mexico A&M]] students who had died in [[World War II]], [[World War I]], and the [[Spanish–American War]], among whom was Henry C. Gilbert Jr., whose parents were instrumental in the 10-year-long fundraising drive. Memorial Stadium, which served for 28 seasons, was replaced both due to its small size (at maximum, the seating capacity was only 12,155) and the want of an expanded athletics plant with more infrastructure and parking. (Currently Memorial Tower, which was originally part of the press box of the stadium, is the only remaining reminder of the stadium. It is now structurally incorporated into the university's Health and Social Services building and houses a memorial lounge and computer lab.) ==The "New" stadium== The "new" Aggie Memorial Stadium, dedicated to [[alumni]] who had served in the [[Korean War]] and [[Vietnam War]], was built for $4 million over a period of 18 months. It was funded by the state legislature as part of a capital project on the campus. The first home game saw the Aggies defeat rival [[University of Texas at El Paso|UTEP]] 35–32 on September 16, 1978. 20 years (and 10 days) later, the Aggies and Miners played to the largest crowd in stadium history, with 32,993 in attendance to see the Aggies win again, 33–24. ==Stadium design== The stadium, designed by alumnus Craig Protz of Bohering-Protz Associates, was built just to the south of the [[Pan American Center]], the home of Aggie basketball. The stadium boasts a unique design in which earth that was excavated to construct the lower bowl and field level was moved to the sides of the stadium to support the upper level, with a street level concourse dividing the lower and upper bowls. The first level of seating wraps around the field, except for two {{convert|100|ft|m|sing=on}} wide gaps behind each end zone. The southern end is a grass berm, with the Fulton Athletics Center, a $6 million structure constructed in 2004 housing athletics offices, an athletic training and education center, and club facilities, behind it. The northern end leads to the locker room facilities and main entrance to the stadium. Because of these gaps it was previously impossible to access the east side of the stadium from the west, and vice versa, without exiting the stadium and re-entering on the other side. A bridge over the north ramp constructed prior to the 2006 season now allows fans to cross from one side of the stadium to the other. The seating extends to a rounded second level on either side of the field, which extends the length of the playing field. The curved, undulating design of the upper level is reminiscent of similarly designed structures such as Memphis' [[Liberty Bowl Stadium]] and the now-demolished [[Tampa Stadium]], albeit on a somewhat smaller scale. {{Panorama|image=Image:NMSU AggieMemorialStadium.jpg |fullwidth=22113 |fullheight=1916 |caption=Aggie Memorial Stadium|height=300}} ==Improvements== The original four pole sodium vapor lighting system is now augmented by four additional smaller poles added prior to the 2005 season to increase the stadium's lighting capacity for televised night games. For the 2007 season, a new $1.5 million scoreboard including a 38'x23' video screen has been added to the facility, as well as a new team meeting and video room complex adjacent to the field house on the stadium's north end. ==Other uses== In addition to football, the stadium occasionally hosts major concerts and other large outdoor gatherings on campus. ===Concerts=== Artists that have performed at the stadium include [[Metallica]], [[Guns N' Roses]], [[Faith No More]], [[Eagles (band)|The Eagles]], [[Vans Warped Tour]] & [[Paul McCartney]], among others. {| class="wikitable" style=font-size:100% style="text-align:center" |- ! width=12% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Date ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Artist ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Opening act(s) ! width=16% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Tour / Concert name ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Attendance ! width=10% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Revenue ! width=20% style="text-align:center;{{CollegePrimaryStyle|New Mexico State Aggies|color=#FFFFFF}};|Notes |- | August 27, 1992 || [[Guns N' Roses]]
[[Metallica]] || [[Faith No More]] || [[Guns N' Roses/Metallica Stadium Tour]] || 35,373 / 35,373 || $972,758 || |- | April 20, 1993 || [[Paul McCartney]] || — || [[The New World Tour]] || 30,058 / 30,058 || $1,002,625 || [http://www.setlist.fm/setlist/paul-mccartney/1993/aggie-memorial-stadium-las-cruces-nm-23d2387f.html Paul McCartney Setlist Aggie Memorial Stadium, Las Cruces, New Mexico, USA on 20 April 1993] |- | May 3, 1995 || [[Eagles (band)|The Eagles]] || — || Hell Freezes Over Tour || — || — || https://www.setlist.fm/setlist/eagles/1995/aggie-memorial-stadium-las-cruces-nm-1bdbd5dc.html |} ===Other events=== During the 2005–06 renovation of the nearby Pan American Center, the stadium hosted the university's commencement ceremonies, although they returned to the Pan Am following completion of the renovations. Also, [[Mayfield High School (New Mexico)|Mayfield High School]] and [[Las Cruces High School]] play against each other in the stadium every year in November. (Varsity only). Starting in November 2017, [[Onate High School]] and [[Centennial High School (New Mexico)|Centennial High School]] will play each other in the stadium to start a new tradition. == Gallery == {{gallery |title=Views around the stadium |width=250 |height=180 |lines=3 |align=center |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - South Side End Zone & Press Box 01.JPG |alt1=Aggie Memorial Stadium - South Side End Zone & Press Box 01 |South side end zone & press box |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - North Side Video Board 01.JPG |alt2=Aggie Memorial Stadium - Video Board |North side video board |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - East Side Stands & Skybox Construction 01.JPG |alt3=Aggie Memorial Stadium - East Side Stands & Skybox Construction 01 |East side stands and Skybox construction |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - East Side Stands & Skybox Construction 02.JPG |alt4=Aggie Memorial Stadium - East Side Stands & Skybox Construction 02 |Closer view of east stand Skybox |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - Fulton Center Skybox 01.JPG |alt5=Fulton Center Skybox |Fulton Center Skybox |File:NMSU Fulton Athletics Center (Front Entrance) 04.JPG |alt6=NMSU Fulton Athletics Center (Front Entrance) 04 |Fulton Athletics Center (Front entrance) |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - ROTC Cannon & Bell.JPG |alt7=Aggie Memorial Stadium - ROTC Cannon & Bell |ROTC cannon and bell |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - Outside, Fulton Center & East Outer Grass Embankment.JPG |alt8=Aggie Memorial Stadium - Outside, Fulton Center & East Outer Grass Embankment |Fulton Center and east embankment |File:Aggie Memorial Stadium - Stadium Map.JPG |alt9=Stadium map and concessions locations |Stadium map |File:NMSU AggiesFootballGame.JPG |alt10=NMSU AggiesFootballGame |NMSU Aggies vs Cal Bears }} ==See also== * [[List of NCAA Division I FBS football stadiums]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110714190149/http://www.nmstatesports.com/SportSelect.dbml?SPSID=9973&SPID=602&DB_OEM_ID=1900&ATCLID=65986 NM State Sports.com] – Aggie Memorial Stadium {{New Mexico State University}} {{New Mexico State Aggies football navbox}} {{NCAA Division I FBS independent football venue navbox}} {{New Mexico college football venues}} [[Category:College football venues]] [[Category:New Mexico State Aggies football]] [[Category:American football venues in New Mexico]] [[Category:1978 establishments in New Mexico]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 1978]]

colspan="4" |[[Active departments of Al-Ahli Sports Club of Amman|Al-Ahli SC Amman]] |- style="font-size: 85%; text-align: center" |[[file:Football_pictogram.svg|connection=https://ar.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D9%85%D9%84%D9%81:Football_pictogram.svg|60x60px]] '''[[Al-Ahli SC (Amman)|Football]]''' |[[file:Basketball_pictogram.svg|connection=https://ar.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D9%85%D9%84%D9%81:Basketball_pictogram.svg|60x60px]] '''[[Al-Ahli SC Basketball (Amman)|Basketball]]''' |- style="font-size: 85%; text-align: center" |[[file:Handball_pictogram.svg|connection=https://ar.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D9%85%D9%84%D9%81:Handball_pictogram.svg|60x60px]] '''[[Al-Ahli SC Handball(Amman)|Handball]]''' | |} '''Al-Ahli Sports Club''' ({{lang-ar|النادي الأهلي الرياضي الأردني}}), is one of the oldest clubs in Jordan based in [[Amman]], established in 1944 by a group of pioneers who helped in setting the groundwork of sport, social, and cultural life in Jordan. ==History== The club was founded in 1944 under the [[Circassians]] name Koban club. The name (Al Ahli) was honorably given by the late King [[Abdullah I of Jordan|Abdullah Bin al Hussein I]].[http://www.ahliclubjo.org/%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%8A%D8%AE-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%8A/] ==Stadium== Al-Ahli plays their home games at [[Amman International Stadium]] in Amman. The stadium was built on 1964 and opened on 1968, it is owned by The Jordanian government and operated by The higher council of youth. It is also the home stadium of [[Jordan national football team]], [[Al-Jazeera (Jordan)|Al-Jazeera]] and [[Al-Faisaly SC (Amman)|Al-Faisaly]]. It has a current capacity of 17,619 spectators. ==Kits== Al-Ahli's home kit is all white shirts and black shorts, while their away kit is all green shirts and shorts. ===Kit suppliers and shirt sponsors=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" ! style="color:#FFFFFF; background:green;"|Period ! style="color:#FFFFFF; background:green;"|Kit supplier ! style="color:#FFFFFF; {{Infobox American football team | name = All Mitsubishi Lions | logo = AllMitsubishiLions.png | helmet = | uniform = | established = 2001 | suspended = | folded = | location = [[Hachioji]], [[Tokyo]] | field = | colors = Navy Blue and Gold{{cite web|title=X-League profile, All Mitsubishi Lions|url= http://www.xleague.com/profile/hel-lions.php|date=April 17, 2015|accessdate=December 30, 2015}} | nickname = | coach = Akira Hayashi | manager = | owner = | mascot = | league = [[X-League]] | division = Central | league_champ_type = [[Japan X Bowl]] titles: | league_champs = | div_champs = | website = http://lions.vc/}} The '''All Mitsubishi Lions''' are an [[American football]] team located in [[Hachiōji]], [[Tokyo]], [[Japan]]. They are a member of the [[X-League]]. ==Team History== *2001 Team Founded. First named the '''Lions''' Finished 4th in the Central division (2 wins, 3 losses). *2002 Finished 3rd in the East Division (3 wins, 2 losses). *2003 New sponsorship with [[Mitsubishi Electric]]. Team renamed the '''All Mitsubishi Lions'''. Finished 4th in the Central Division (1 win, 3 losses, 1 tie). *2004 Finished 3rd in the East division (1 win, 2 losses, 2 ties). *2010 Finished 4th in the East division (2 wins, 3 losses). *2011 Finished 3rd in the East division (3 wins, 2 losses). Advanced to the 2nd stage ''Super9'' for the first time in team history. Lost 2nd stage matches to [[Obic Seagulls|Obic]] 0-49 and to [[Asahi Soft Drink Challengers|Asahi Soft Drinks]] 3-24. *2012 Finished 5th in the Central division (1 win, 4 losses). *2013 Finished 4th in the Central division (2 wins, 3 losses). Qualified for the 2nd stage ''Battle9''. Advanced to the ''Battle9'' Final where they defeated the [[Elecom Kobe Finies]] 24-21. *2014 Finished 4th in the Central division (2 wins, 3 losses). Advanced to the ''Battle9'' Final where they defeated the [[As One Black Eagles]] 35-10. *2015 Finished 4th in the East division (2 wins, 3 losses). Advanced to the ''Battle9'' Final for the 3rd consecutive year where they defeated the As One Black Eagles 24-21. ==Name== From 2001 to 2002, the team was simply known as the '''Lions'''. revision.text:
{{ infobox venue | name = Techtonic Velodrome |image=[[File:Velodrome Panorama1 resize.jpg|400px]] |imagesize= |caption=Techtonic Velodrome, as seen from the stands |fullname=Techtonic Velodrome |city=[[Cape Town]], [[South Africa]] |capacity=7,800 |built= 1997 |opened= 1997 |closed= |demolished= |tenants= |dimensions= }} The '''Techtonic Velodrome''' is a 250-meter, multi-purpose indoor [[velodrome]] located in [[Bellville, Western Cape|Bellville]] (about 25 kilometers outside of the centre of [[Cape Town]]), [[South Africa]].
The velodrome was initially developed for the South African Olympic Bid, this venue hosted the World Cycling Federation Championships in 1999. The project was completed in 9 months from inception. The Velodrome features an acoustically treated soffit lining for purposes of hosting music and other entertainment events. The Velodrome was designed as a phased development with [[seating capacity]] on completion of up to 6000 seats (existing seats currently are 2500 and Event Organiser can provide the balance to bring it up to 6000 seats) or standing capacity is 7800. Phase 1 is complete and various designs exist as well as development proposals for the surrounding property to support the functions of the Velodrome.
The venue has served as Cape Town's main concert venue for the last ten years and has now been replaced by the [[Cape Town Stadium]]. Its maximum capacity for cycling competition would range from 5-8,000.
On September 5, 2007, [[WWE]]'s RAW SummerSlam Tour took place with over 7000 fans in attendance.
The velodrome hosted the 2007 UCI "B" World Championship in June 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://oldsite.uci.ch/modello.asp?1stLevelID=PA&level1=0&level2=0&idnews=3962 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-01-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100328230924/http://oldsite.uci.ch/modello.asp?1stLevelID=PA&level1=0&level2=0&idnews=3962 |archivedate=2010-03-28 |df= }}</ref>
It was also the venue for the [[2008 UCI Junior World Championships]], which was awarded to the city of Cape Town.<ref>[http://www.southafrica.info/news/sport/cycling-240608.htm]</ref>
It was also the home of the [[Organised Chaos LAN Party]], South Africa's biggest monthly [[gamer|gaming]] event. Organised Chaos moved to a different venue after the commencing of The Galleria Development early in 2012, but still make use of the Bellville Velodrome for large events from time to time.<ref>[http://www.oc.co.za]</ref>
==The Galleria Development== At a Council meeting on 28 October 2009, approval was given for the City of Cape Town to award a R3 billion tender to establish retail, business, residential, hotel and conference facilities on an 11.5 ha property in the Bellville Velodrome precinct.
The tender was won by Devmet Property Developments, a consortium of Devmark Property Group (Pty) Limited and Mettle Property Group (Pty) Limited, through a competitive bidding process that lasted more than two years. Mettle Property Group is 49% owned by Metropolitan Capital, an associated company of the Metropolitan Group, and is a level eight contributor in terms of Broad Based Black Economic Empowerment (BBBEE).
The development is based on a spine ‘Galleria’ that will provide the circulation and connection to all the facilities. Parking with entrances at various levels and locations will be provided to connect the hotel, conference and sporting facilities with the retail, business and residential components.
Devmet Property Developments has put together a group of companies and management models that offer a suitable range of skills and experience in property development, property management, financial oversight, facilities management and events management. They incorporate and provide local and international experience, strategic partnerships and networks, and innovative technologies, designs and processes. The group includes Devmet, Big Concerts, the High Performance Sports Centre and several smaller, specialist firms,” Gelderbloem added.
The overally capacity of the venue will be increased to 18,000 with the upgrade to the velodrome and adjoining athletics venue considered as part of Phase 1.
It was initially envisaged that the development will be completed by 2014, however, as of November 2013, no construction work has taken place. There was some concern as to the developments effect on the surrounding suburbs as a road will need to be built through local suburbs and parks, but after public hearings the plan to build a road was withdrawn.<ref>http://www.kenridgeratepayers.co.za/news/kenridge-news/story/871/public-meeting-bellville-velodrome-12-june-2013-19h00.html</ref>
==Concerts==
* [[Jay-Z]] * [[Rihanna]] * [[Toto (band)|Toto]] * [[Jimmy Eat World]] * [[50 Cent]] * [[P!nk]] * [[The Offspring]] * [[Counting Crows]] * [[Bryan Adams]] * [[The Cranberries]] * [[Faithless]] * [[The Prodigy]] * [[Live (band)|LIVE]] * [[Alanis Morissette]] * [[Avril Lavigne]] * [[Lil Wayne]] * [[David Gray (musician)|David Gray]] * [[Billy Joel]] * [[Mary J Blige]] * [[Kanye West]] * [[Groove Armada]] * [[R.E.M.]] * [[Sting (musician)|Sting]] * [[Roger Waters]] * [[Armin Van Buuren]] * [[Westlife]] * [[Ronan Keating]] * [[Simply Red]] * [[Bruce Springsteen]] * [[Metallica]] * [[Sixto Rodriguez]]

{{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{Copyedit|date=May 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Belén Rodríguez | image = Belen Rodriguez 3.jpg | caption = Belén Rodríguez in 2009 | birth_name = Maria Belén Rodríguez Cozzani | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|9|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] | spouse = {{marriage|[[:es:Stefano De Martino|Stefano De Martino]]
|2013|2017|reason=divorced}} | children = 1 (Santiago De Martino, born 2013) | height = 175 cm | occupation = [[Television personality]], [[actress]], [[Fashion model|model]], [[singer]], [[dancer]], [[showgirl]] | years_active = 2001–present | website = {{URL|www.belenrodriguez.it}} }} '''María Belén Rodríguez Cozzani''' ({{IPA-es|maˈɾi.a βeˈlen roˈðɾiɣes koˈsani}}, {{IPA-it|kotˈtsaːni|lang}}; born 20 September 1984) is an [[Italian Argentines|Italian-Argentine]] showgirl. Known as '''Belén Rodríguez''' or as '''Belén''', she has been based in [[Milan]], [[Italy]] since 2004. Belén hosted many variety shows, she appeared in many television commercials and she recited in many films and fictions. Considered a [[sex symbol]] of the [[2000s (decade)|2000s]] and 2010s, due to her considerable beauty and charm Belen posed for multiple [[nude calendar]]s and she made news, both in Italy and internationally, in magazines and tabloids for the developments of her career in the Italian showbiz and of her love stories. The international press nicknamed Belén "the [[Rioplatense]] [[Sophia Loren]]" and "the Italian [[Sara Carbonero]]". Belén hosted in February 2011 the ''[[Sanremo Music Festival]]'', one of the most important shows in Europe; she is the third [[Argentine]] in ''Sanremo'' after [[Valeria Mazza]] and [[Lola Ponce]]. [[Cecilia Rodríguez]], an [[Argentine]] showgirl active in Italy since 2008, is Belén's younger sister. == Biography == === Early life === Belén was born on 20 September 1984 in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]][http://www.diariouno.com.ar/espectaculos/Conoce-a-Belen-Rodriguez-la-argentina-que-deslumbra-a-losespaoles-20110506-0005.html Conocé a Belén, la argentina que deslumbra a los españoles]. ''Diariouno.com.ar''. 6 May 2011. Retrieved 28 July 2011. to Gustavo Rodríguez and Veronica Cozzani de Rodríguez. Veronica, of [[Italian Argentine|Italian origin]], is the daughter of [[immigrant]]s from [[La Spezia]] in [[Liguria]]. Belén has a younger brother, [[Jeremias Rodriguez|Jeremías]],{{cite web|last=Montesano |first=Anna |url=http://www.gossipetv.com/belen-rodriguez-santiago-de-martino-commuove-il-web-e-la-mamma-116620 |title=Belen Rodriguez: Santiago De Martino commuove il web e la mamma |website=Gossipetv.com |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} and a younger sister, Cecilia.{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/112252/isola-dei-famosi-2015-cecilia-rodriguez-playa-desnuda |title=Isola dei Famosi 2015 | Cecilia Rodriguez | Playa Desnuda |website=DavideMaggio.it |date= |accessdate=2016-07-21}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/718074/cecilia-rodriguez-isola-dei-famosi-2015 |title=Cecilia Rodriguez | Isola 10 |website=Tvblog.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://it.celebrity.yahoo.com/blog/oh-my-gossip/belen-difende-cecilia-dalle-critiche---una-sorella-pi%C3%B9-bella-di-te-non-esiste-164451358.html|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20141126223811/https://it.celebrity.yahoo.com/blog/oh-my-gossip/belen-difende-cecilia-dalle-critiche---una-sorella-pi%C3%B9-bella-di-te-non-esiste-164451358.html|dead-url=yes|archivedate=26 November 2014|title=Belen difende Cecilia dalle critiche: "Una sorella più bella di te no…|date=26 November 2014|publisher=}} At the age of 10, Belén moved to [[Pilar, Buenos Aires|Pilar]] with her family. She graduated from [[high school]] in December 2001 at the age of 17, and later she enrolled in the ''Faculty of Communication Sciences'' at the [[University of Buenos Aires]],{{cite web|url=http://dalje.com/en-celebrities/photo--stripper-over-whom-nina-moric-overdosed/222494 |title=PHOTO: Stripper Over Whom Nina Moric Overdosed – Entertainment – Celebrities |website=Dalje.com |date=9 January 2009 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} but did not complete her studies because of ever-increasing career commitments, first undertaken in late 2000 when she was 16; Belen started her career as a model, initially in Argentina and then internationally. Her younger sister, Cecilia (born on 18 March 1990 in [[Pilar, Argentina]]), has also been active in Italian [[show business]] since 2008{{cite web|url=http://www.publiweb.com/glamour/cecilia-rodriguez/ |title=Cecilia Rodriguez la bellissima sorella di Belen |language=it |website=Publiweb.com |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} and as a model.{{cite web|url=http://www.qnm.it/bellezze/showgirls_straniere/cecilia_rodriguez/ |title=Cecilia Rodriguez | QNM |website=Qnm.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} Since January 2014, Cecilia has been Belén's business partner. Since August 2015, [[Jeremías Rodríguez|Jeremías]], Gustavo and Veronica have lived in [[Milan]].[http://www.tgcom24.mediaset.it/people/belen-mamma-e-papa-si-trasferiscono-a-milano_2127531-201502a.shtml] Belen's younger brother, [[Jeremías Rodríguez]] (born on 11 November 1988 in [[Pilar, Argentina]]), has also been active in Italian [[show business]] since 2017.[https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/152503/grande-fratello-vip-2017-jeremias-rodriguez] === Personal life === From August 2004 to December 2008,{{cite web|url=http://archiviostorico.corriere.it/2008/dicembre/17/Borriello_Con_Belen_tutto_finito_co_9_081217060.shtml|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120701125611/http://archiviostorico.corriere.it/2008/dicembre/17/Borriello_Con_Belen_tutto_finito_co_9_081217060.shtml|deadurl=yes|archivedate=1 July 2012|title=Borriello: "Con Belen è tutto finito"|date=1 July 2012|publisher=|df=dmy-all}} Belén was the girlfriend of [[Marco Borriello]], at that time a footballer for [[A.C. Milan]]. From January 2009{{cite web |url=http://archiviostorico.corriere.it/2009/gennaio/14/Belen_Fabrizio_Corona_love_story_co_9_090114058.shtml |title=Archivio Storico |website=Archive.is |accessdate=21 July 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130413040244/http%3A%2F%2Farchiviostorico.corriere.it%2F2009%2Fgennaio%2F14%2FBelen_Fabrizio_Corona_love_story_co_9_090114058.shtml |archivedate=13 April 2013 |df= }} to April 2012{{cite web |url=http://www.corriere.it/spettacoli/12_aprile_22/belen-lascia-corona-emma-marrone-fidanzato_776b920c-8c6e-11e1-a888-e468d0e8abab.shtml |title=Spettacoli |website=Archive.is |accessdate=21 July 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120731065124/http%3A%2F%2Fwww.corriere.it%2Fspettacoli%2F12_aprile_22%2Fbelen-lascia-corona-emma-marrone-fidanzato_776b920c-8c6e-11e1-a888-e468d0e8abab.shtml |archivedate=31 July 2012 |df= }} Belén was in a relationship with [[Fabrizio Corona]]; they broke up when she met the dancer [[Stefano De Martino]], her future first husband. Belén had a son, Santiago, on 9 April 2013{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/73068/belen-ha-partorito-e-nato-santiago-de-martino |title=Belen Rodriguez mamma: è nato Santiago De Martino |website=DavideMaggio.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} in Milan with Stefano De Martino; the couple were married on 20 September 2013;{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.daringtodo.com/lang/it/2013/09/15/belen-rodriguez-i-segreti-del-matrimonio-dellanno/ |title=Belen Rodriguez: i segreti del matrimonio dell'anno |website=Daringtodo.com |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} on 22 December 2015, they separated.{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/spettacoli/people/2015/03/18/foto/crisi_tra_belen_e_stefano_la_rivista_chi_rivela_lui_dorme_in_albergo_-109821283/1/?ref=HRESS-6#1|title=L'avvocato di Belen: ''Si separa da Stefano'' - Spettacoli|website=Repubblica.it|date=18 March 2015|accessdate=21 July 2016}} De Martino and Belén were legally divorced on 24 January 2017 when they signed a judicial agreement at the Court of Milan;{{cite web|url=http://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/17_gennaio_25/belen-stefano-si-separano-legalmente-l-addio-tribunale-43a3c550-e2d3-11e6-91bb-de3c4de78c88.shtml|title=Belen e Stefano De Martino si separano legalmente: la commozione dell'addio in Tribunale|first=Elisabetta|last=Andreis|publisher=}} as part of this ''divorzio breve'' (fast-track divorce), De Martino was ordered to pay one thousand euros every month to his son Santiago{{cite web|url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/spettacoli/belen-e-stefano-si-sono-separati-ufficialmente-lui-deve-1355954.html|title=Belen e Stefano si sono separati ufficialmente. Lui deve darle 1000 euro al mese|publisher=}} until he reaches majority. The divorce legally went into force 6 months later. To avoid a lengthy public trial, De Martino neither demanded nor received money from his former wife,{{cite web|url=http://www.dagospia.com/rubrica-2/media_e_tv/se-potessi-avere-mille-euro-mese-belen-stefano-de-martino-140157.htm|title=belen e stefano de martino: lui verserà 1000 € per il figlio, che vedrà due weekend al mese|publisher=}} and he is not required to pay money to her. Their son lives with Belén. == Career == Since 2004,{{cite web|url=http://www.boticadelespectaculo.com/2011/01/la-sofia-loren-rioplatense-belen.html |title=La Sofía Loren rioplatense Belén Rodríguez | Botica Del Espectaculo, Telenovelas, Television, Videos Musica e Información |website=Boticadelespectaculo.com |date=2004-02-26 |accessdate=2016-07-21}} Belén has lived in Italy, where she has hosted variety shows, appeared in television commercials, films, and television programs.{{cite web|url=http://www.europapress.es/chance/gente/noticia-stefano-martino-belen-rodriguez-hijo-ibiza-20150615113316.html |title=Belén Rodríguez y Stefano De Martino en la playa de Ibiza con la familia |language=Spanish |website=Europapress.es |date=15 June 2015 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} Considered a [[sex symbol]] of the 2000s and 2010s,{{cite web|url=http://www.arcobalenotre.com/portfolio-items/belen-rodriguez/ |title=Belen Rodriguez management agente agenzia manager |website=Arcobalenotre.com |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2016-07-21}} Belén posed in Italy for ''[[Playboy]]'' and several [[nude calendar]]s.{{cite web|url=http://koktail.pravda.sk/sexi-soubiznis/clanok/358843-toto-je-zarucene-najsexi-moderatorka-planety-jej-krivky-su-ohurujuce/ |title=Toto je zaručene najsexi moderátorka planéty! Jej krivky sú ohurujúce – Sexi šoubiznis – Koktail – Pravda.sk |website=Koktail.pravda.sk |date=19 June 2015 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} The tabloid press in Italy and abroad have closely followed her career and personal life. The international press nicknamed her "the [[Rioplatense]] [[Sophia Loren]]" and "the Italian [[Sara Carbonero]]". In February 2011, Belén hosted the prestigious ''[[Sanremo Music Festival]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.adnkronos.com/IGN/News/Spettacolo/Gianni-Morandi-conduce-Sanremo-Ad-affiancarlo-Canalis-Belen-e-le-Iene_311065643523.html |title=Adnkronos |website=Adnkronos.com |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} one of the most important shows in Europe; she was the 3rd Argentinian host of this music festival after [[Valeria Mazza]] and [[Lola Ponce]]. During her long career, Belén has worked with many important Italian television personalities, including [[Gerry Scotti]], [[Maria De Filippi]], [[Paolo Bonolis]], [[Michelle Hunziker]] and [[Gianni Morandi]]. === Singer === In the spring of 2007, the singer [[Taiyo Yamanouchi]], during the run of ''{{ill|Tintoria|it|Tintoria (programma televisivo)}}'' on [[Rai 3]], proposed to Belén an exclusive contract to launch her toward a potential musical career, but she (who was Taiyo Yamanouchi's partner in the hosting of that program) rejected the offer, preferring to continue her career as model, showgirl, and actress.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.musicalnews.com/articolo.php?codice=9429&sz=3 |title=Taiyo Yamanouchi: un rapper in Tintoria |website=Musicalnews.com |date=16 July 2016 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} In the autumn of 2007, Belén played with her personal friend [[Claudia Galanti]],{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/personaggi/2014/01/20/ma-questa-e-belen-rodriguez-e-questaltra-claudia-galanti-il-sexy-video-uscito-dal-cassetto/ |title=Ma questa è Belen Rodriguez e quest'altra Claudia Galanti! Il sexy video uscito dal cassetto | Gossip |website=Oggi.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} the [[female lead]] in the [[videoclip]] ''Boyfriend'', released in 2008 as part of the rapper [[Coolio]]'s ''[[Steal Hear]]'' album.{{cite web|url=http://www.menchic.it/news/belen-18enne-e-sexy-nel-suo-primo-video-hot-guarda-23227.html |title=Belen 18enne e sexy nel suo primo video Hot ! Guarda ! - Moda uomo, lifestyle | Menchic.itModa uomo, lifestyle |website=Menchic.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} In the summer of 2009, Belén made her debut as singer with the song ''[[Dai muovi muovi]]'', written by Mario Gardini and composed by [[Giovanni Paolo Fontana]] and [[Roberto De Luca]], the theme song of the ''[[Sarabanda]]'''s edition hosted by Belén on [[Canale 5]]. In February 2010 Belén debuted, as a singer contestant, at the [[Teatro Ariston]] with ''{{ill|Aeroplani|it|Aeroplani (singolo)}}'', a single by [[Toto Cutugno]] that she also sang at the ''[[Sanremo Music Festival 2010|2010 Sanremo Festival]]'' in a duet with Cutugno. In February 2015, during the [[Sanremo Music Festival 2015|Sanremo's Festival]], Belén, using the stage name of ''[[Belen Rodriguez|Maria Belén]]'', released the single ''[[Amarti è folle]]'', written and arranged by [[Fortunato Zampaglione]] for the soundtrack of the film ''[[Non c'è due senza te]]''. === Actress === In the summer of 2010 Belén made her debut{{cite web|url=http://www.mymovies.it/film/2010/nataleinsudafrica/news/lesordiodibelenrodriguezalcinema |title=Natale in Sud Africa: L'esordio di Belen Rodriguez al cinema |website=MYmovies.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} as an actress as the [[female lead]] in the filming of the [[cinepanettone]]{{cite web|url=http://www.direttanews.it/2010/10/04/natale-in-sudafrica-christian-de-sica-trama-e-cast-del-nuovo-cinepanettone/ |title=NATALE IN SUDAFRICA / Christian De Sica, trama e cast del nuovo cinepanettone |website=Direttanews.it |date=13 July 2016 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} ''[[Natale in Sudafrica]]'', directed by [[Neri Parenti]] and released on 17 December 2010.{{cite web|url=http://movieplayer.it/film/natale-in-sudafrica_27732/#italia |title=Natale in Sudafrica (2010) – Film |website=Movieplayer.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} In the autumn of 2010 she played the [[female lead]] in{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemaitaliano.info/news/07520/se-sei-cosi-ti-dico-si-la-coppia-solfrizzi.html |title="Se sei così ti dico sì", la coppia Solfrizzi-Belen funziona (e il film pure) |website=CinemaItaliano.info |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} the [[feature film]] ''[[Se sei così, ti dico sì]]'' directed by [[Eugenio Cappuccio]] and released on 15 April 2011. In the autumn of 2010 she appeared as the [[female lead]] in the episode ''[[The Potter's Field (Camilleri novel)|Il campo del vasaio]]'' of the [[Rai 1]] [[TV series|television series]] ''[[Inspector Montalbano (TV series)|Il commissario Montalbano]]'', which aired for the first time on 14 March 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/24399/il-commissario-montalbano-il-campo-del-vasaio-rai1 |title=Il commissario Montalbano torna da domani su Rai1 con quattro nuovi film tv |website=Tvblog.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} In the 2011–2012 season Belén was the [[guest star]] in a few episodes{{cite web|author=Elisabetta Esposito |url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/spettacoli/belen-rodriguez-guest-star-don-matteo-1163654.html |title=Belen Rodriguez guest star in Don Matteo |language=it |website=IlGiornale.it |date=26 August 2015 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} of the second season of ''[[Così fan tutte (TV series)|Così fan tutte]]'', an [[Italia 1]] [[sitcom]] directed by [[Gianluca Fumagalli]]. In the spring of 2012 Belén debuted as a [[Dubbing (music)|dubbing]] [[voice]] in the [[animated film]] ''[[Gladiatori di Roma]]'', directed by [[Iginio Straffi]] and released on 18 October 2012.[https://archive.is/20140427011402/http://spettacoli.blogosfere.it/2012/10/belen-rodriguez-gladiatori-di-roma-3d-voce-della-dea-diana-estenuata-dalle-domande-sulla-gravidanza.html 2015.{{cite web|author=Di Federico Boni |url=http://www.cineblog.it/post/409913/non-ce-2-senza-te-video-interviste-a-fabio-troiano-e-dino-abbrescia |title=Non c'è 2 senza te | Trailer | Clip | Video decima serie di Don Matteo – Spettacolo |website=Ansa.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}} Belén's role as [[guest star]] in the [[:it:Episodi di Don Matteo (decima stagione)|tenth season]]{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.msn.com/it-it/tv/notizie/don-matteo-10-arriva-bel%C3%A9n/ar-AAdUtkV?li=AA4WSJ |title=Don Matteo 10: arriva Belén |website=Msn.com |date=8 July 2016 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} of the [[Rai 1]] [[TV series|television series]] ''[[Don Matteo]]''; the episode with Belén, titled ''{{ill|La colpa|it|Episodi di Don Matteo (decima stagione)#La colpa}}'', was first aired on FOTO fotogallery | Sky TG24 |website=Tg24.sky.it |date= |accessdate=21 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://blogseduzione.com/2012/02/bellabelen-il-nuovo-fotolibro-sulla-vita-di-belen-rodriguez/ |title=BellaBelen il nuovo fotolibro sulla vita di Belen Rodriguez presentato a Milano. | Blog Seduzione |website=blogseduzione.com |date= |accessdate=3 February 2012}} In June 2015 Belén opened a new restaurant in [[Milan]] (specifically the historian restaurant named ''Ricci'' situated in ''Piazza della Repubblica'') with the judge of ''[[MasterChef Italia]]'' [[Joe Bastianich]] and two other partners ([[Luca Guelfi]] and [[Simona Miele]], the holders of ''Petit Bistrot'' in [[Miami]] and Milan).{{cite web|last=Montesano |first=Anna |url=http://www.gossipetv.com/belen-rodriguez-inaugura-il-ricci-tra-affetti-e-scatti-damore-176759 |title=Belen Rodríguez inaugura il Ricci tra affetti e scatti d'amore |website=Gossipetv.com |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} At around the same time Belén opened the beauty salons{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.it/people/italia/15/06/23/belen-rodriguez-intervista-foto-stefano-de-martino-parrucchiere-cotril-milano |title=Belén Rodriguez: 'L'amore è dopo i tre anni' |website=Vanity Fair Italy |date=24 June 2015 |accessdate=21 July 2016}} of ''[[Cotril]]'', an Italian company for which Belén is spokesperson and business partner. On 2 September 2015 the ''Ricci'' causing a stir in the Italian media because the ''Ricci'' received a good review{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/02/dining/saucy-in-brooklyn-isnt-just-for-catering.html|title=Saucy in Brooklyn Isn't Just for Catering|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=21 July 2016}} in the ''Food section'' of ''[[The New York Times]]''. In December 2017, the ''Ricci'' was closed[http://www.gossipblog.it/post/545793/joe-bastianich-dopo-la-chiusura-del-ricci-belen-non-so-se-faro-altro-con-lei][http://www.dagospia.com/rubrica-2/media_e_tv/belin-belen-quot-ha-lato-gonfio-come-mongolfiera-quot-162758.htm] and sold.[http://www.dagospia.com/rubrica-2/media_e_tv/ricci-pasticci-chiude-ristorante-belen-joe-bastianich-suo-162039.htm][https://www.gossip.it/news/joe-bastianich-ricci-chiuso-belen-news.html] From 2013 to 2015, Belén fundedsee the cover story of ''[[Chi (magazine)|Chi]]'' of 30 December 2015 various entrepreneurial initiatives by Stefano De Martino (who was at that time her first husband) that ended up being very unsuccessful; these failures, according to ''[[Chi (magazine)|Chi]]'', are among the reasons leading to their separation in December 2015. For example, in October 2014 Belén Rodríguez and De Martino founded a chain of clothing stores in Milan named ''4store''. Following initial success, in mid-2015 this chain was expanded to the area around Milan but failed later that year. Due to financial losses due to Stefano De Martino's failed entrepreneurial adventures, Belen had to sell for example the ''[[Imperfect]]'' brand just to pay the financial hole created by Stefano De Martino. === Model === Belén began her career in 2001 at the age of 17[http://dalje.com/en/foto.php?id=22&rbr=10898&idrf=498217] as a model in Argentina, Miami, and Mexico: she became the spokesperson for several lines of intimate wear. She posed also for important magazine covers, continuing in Italy beginning in 2004. Between 2004 and 2008 Belén took part in Milan fashion shows for spring/summer collections of ''[[Pin-Up Star]]'', and she worked for other fashion houses such as ''[[Miss Sixty]]'', ''[[Taglia 42]]'', ''[[Cotonella]]'', and ''[[Yamamay]]''. In the autumn of 2007, she had the main role, alongside [[Elisabetta Canalis]] and [[Christian De Sica]], in the television commercials of [[TIM (brand)|TIM]] as ''Donna dei Sogni'' (Dream Woman). The collaboration between Belén and TIM continued until February 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/bianca-balti-ecco-nuova-belen.html|title=Bianca Balti, ecco la nuova Belen|publisher=}} Starting in January 2008 she worked as a model and spokesperson at the fashion shows of ''[[John Richmond (fashion designer)|John Richmond]]'', ''[[Pitti]]'', ''[[Vanitas]]'', ''[[Jadea]]'', ''[[Trendy Too]]'' and other brands in Florence, Rome, Naples, and Milan. Belen then worked as a model, spokesperson, and businesswoman with ''[[Cotril]]'' (chain of hair and beauty salons), ''[[Jadea]]'' (intimate wear brand), and ''[[Imperfect]]'' (clothing brand). From January 2012 she was the spokesperson for the jewellery firm ''[[2Jewels]]'' and the technology firm ''[[Linkdem]]''. In February 2012 posed naked for the cover of the Italian edition of ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', causing quite a stir.{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.it/people/italia/12/02/belen-rodriguez-intervista-aborto-video-hard|title=Belén: "Dedicato a chi pensa che abbia inventato tutto" - VanityFair.it|publisher=Vanity Fair Italia}} In July 2012{{cite web|url=http://www.gqitalia.it/eros-girls/articles/2012/7/belen-a-los-angeles-con-gq-italia-il-video-del-backstage/|title=Belén a Los Angeles con GQ Italia, il video del backstage – GQItalia.it|publisher=}} Belen posed naked for the cover of the Italian edition of ''[[GQ]]'', photographed by [[Douglas Kirkland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.style.it/star/gossip-news/2012/07/2/belen-su-gq-italia-di-luglio.aspx|title=Fenomenologia di Belén su GQ|publisher=}} which also aroused much interest. In May 2013 she became a spokesperson (with [[Gerry Scotti]]) for the "marriage"{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.it/2013/05/23/pasta-barilla-nei-menu-mcdonalds-belen-rodriguez-testimonial-della-collaborazione-tra-i-due-marchi_n_3324339.html|title=Pasta Barilla nei menu McDonald's (FOTO)|publisher=}} between ''[[Barilla]]'' and ''[[McDonald's]]''. She then debuted as a stylist{{cite web|url=http://www.ansa.it/web/notizie/photostory/spettacolo/2013/05/29/Moda-Belen-debutta-come-stilista_8788707.html|title=Moda: Belen debutta come stilista – Photostory Spettacolo – ANSA.it|publisher=ansa.it}} for the clothing line ''[[Imperfect]]'' with [[Fabio Castelli]]. In June 2013 Belén became the spokesperson for the cruise wear line ''[[Bikini Lovers]]'' created by [[fashion blogger]] [[Chiara Biasi]].{{cite web|url=http://velvetstyle.it/2013/06/17/belen-rodriguez-indossa-bikini-lovers-by-chiara-biasi/|title=Belen Rodriguez al mare con i Bikini Lovers by Chiara Biasi – Velvet Style Italia|first=|last=Redazione|publisher=}} Belén and her sister Cecilia in October 2013 presented the 2013–2014 fashion line of ''[[Imperfect]]'' as models and stylists.{{cite web|url=http://velvetstyle.it/2013/10/21/imperfect-la-sorelle-rodriguez-si-sfidano-in-passerella-a-colpi-di-sensualita/|title=Imperfect: sfilata P/E 2014 Belen e Cecilia Rodriguez insieme – Velvet Style Italia|first=|last=Redazione|publisher=}} In December 2013 Belén was the spokesperson{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/belen-e-stefano-ospiti-di-javier-e-paula-zanetti-al-gala-della-fondazione-pupi-solidarieta-tra-argentini-107969|title=Belen e Stefano ospiti di Javier e Paula Zanetti al galà della Fondazione Pupi: solidarietà tra argentini|publisher=|date=12 December 2013}} for the ''[[Pupi Foundation]]'' of [[Javier Zanetti]], and she became the spokesperson (with Stefano De Martino, at that time her 1st husband) for the virtual application software created by ''[[WeChat]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/belen-e-stefano-nella-pubblicita-di-wechat-ma-il-bambino-non-e-santiago-i-fan-delusi-106811|title=Belen e Stefano nella pubblicità di Wechat, ma il bambino non è Santiago: i fan delusi|date=3 December 2013|publisher=}} As models and designers, in February 2014 Belén and Cecilia presented{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/people/vip-e-star/2014/02/21/belen-rodriguez-sfilata-sexy-con-cecilia-e-manda-in-tilt-milano-moda/|title=Belen Rodriguez, sfilata sexy (con Cecilia). E manda in tilt Milano Mo...|publisher=}} the third fashion line of ''[[Imperfect]]''. In the spring of 2014 Belén posed for the cover{{cite web|url=http://www.sologossip.com/2014/03/17/belen-rodriguez-irresistibile-sul-set-di-sport-week-dreams-basta-un-bikini-e-la-showgirl-ha-il-mondo-ai-suoi-piedi-foto-inedite/|title=Belen Rodriguez irresistibile sul set di Sport Week Dreams: basta un bikini e la showgirl ha il mondo ai suoi piedi (FOTO INEDITE)|publisher=}} of ''[[SportWeek]]'', garnering positive acclaim. In that same period she designed and produced, along with Cecilia,{{cite web|url=http://www.tgcom24.mediaset.it/people/2014/notizia/belen-rodriguez-sfila-mezza-nuda_2028319.shtml|title=Belen Rodriguez sfila mezza nuda – Tgcom24|publisher=}} the clothes for the new beachwear line called ''[[Me Fui]]'' for the summer of 2014; at that time Belén became the spokesperson for [[Samsung]]'s mobile phones. In the spring and summer of 2014 she was model and spokesperson (with Stefano De Martino, at that time her first husband) for ''[[John Richmond (fashion designer)|Richmond Perfumes]]''.{{cite web|url=http://news.mtv.it/fashion/belen-rodriguez-e-stefano-de-martino-per-richmond-x-non-solo-profumi/|title=Belen Rodriguez e Stefano De Martino per Richmond X: non solo profumi! - News Mtv Italia|date=26 April 2014|publisher=}} In January 2015{{cite web|url=http://www.socialchannel.it/esclusivo-richmond-cambia-rodriguez-via-belen-arriva-mariana/76884/|title=ESCLUSIVO, Richmond cambia Rodriguez: via Belen e arriva Mariana – Social Channel|publisher=}} definitely ended the professional relationship, which began ten years ago, between Belén and Milan fashion shows for ''[[John Richmond (fashion designer)|John Richmond]]'' in favor of the Venezuelan model [[Mariana Rodríguez]] assisted by [[Paola Benegas]] (who ten years earlier had launched Belen in the world of fashion: this news caused a sensation at the Italian press for this reason, but also because of the alleged relationship, that in reality does not exist, between "the two Rodríguez" launched by [[Paola Benegas]] at Milan fashion shows of ''[[John Richmond (fashion designer)|John Richmond]]'', that are Belén and [[Mariana Rodriguez|Mariana]]). In September 2016 Belén lost ''[[Vanitas]]'' line in favour to [[Madalina Ghenea]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gossip.it/news/madalina-ghenea-vanitas-news.html|title=Madalina Ghenea sposa per Vanitas, che prima aveva Belen, bacia Matei Stratan|publisher=}} In the summer of 2005, Belén posed for the first time{{cite web|url=http://magazine.excite.it/foto/belen-rodriguez-il-suo-primo-calendario-P63839.html|title=Belen Rodriguez, il suo primo calendario|publisher=}} naked for the ''Vuemme Calendar 2006'' (published in late 2005 for the year 2006) of which she was the only model. In the autumn of 2005 Belén posed naked for the ''De Nardi Calendar 2006'' (published in late 2005 for the year 2006) along with three models ([[Eva Collini]], [[Ainett Stephens]] and [[Nena Ristić]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.trovatuttoedicola.it/index.php?mod=calendari&act=show_calendario_mese&id=1103|title=calendario belen rodriguez ainett stephens eva collini nena ristic per de nardi 2006 luglio|first=|last=BASE315|publisher=}} In the summer of 2006 Belén posed naked for the ''Fer Calendar 2007'' (published in late 2006 for the year 2007), in which she was the only model.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/galleria/belen-rodriguez|title=Belen Rodriguez|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/2006/12/calendari/bellezze/belene-rodriguez/belene-rodriguez/1.html|title=Il calendario di Belen Rodriguez |publisher=Repubblica.it}} In the summer of 2007 Belén posed naked for the ''Maxim Calendar 2008'' (published in late 2007 for the year 2008), in which she was the only model.[http://www.dissacration.com/2008/01/13/belen-rodriguez-per-maxim-backstage-del-calendario/]{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipblog.it/video/belen-rodriguez-backstage-maxim|title=Belen Rodriguez BackStage Maxim|publisher=}} In the summer of 2008 Belen posed naked for the ''Max Calendar 2009'' (published in late 2008 for the year 2009), in which she was the only model.{{cite web|url=http://www.areaticino.com/belen_Rodriguez_Max.asp|title=Che bombe(r)! Borriello e Belen Rodriguez la coppia più hot su Max .::. Area Ticino.::. il portale della Svizzera italiana|publisher=}}[http://www.pianetadonna.it/foto_gallery/gossip/belen-rodriguez/belen-rodriguez-nuda-max.html] In the autumn of 2009 Belén posed naked with her sister Cecilia for the ''Max Calendar 2010'' (published in late 2009 for the year 2010) arousing much interest (partly because this [[nude calendar]] featured Cecilia's modelling debut).{{cite web|url=http://www.softblog.it/post/7331/vi-presentiamo-cecilia-rodriguez|title=Vi presentiamo Cecilia Rodriguez|publisher=}} Between late 2009 and early 2010 ''Vuemme'' published a ''Calendar Vuemme 2010'' with Belén as the only model; this calendar, a reprint{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/17216/belen-rodriguez-nuda-ma-il-calendario-e-del-2006|title=Belen Rodriguez nuda – Ma il calendario è del 2006|publisher=}} of the previous one (2006), was successful because Belén's reputation had grown in the intervening four years.{{cite web|url=http://tv.excite.it/calendari-2010-belen-rodriguez-ricicla-quello-del-2006-N63851.html|title=Calendari 2010, Belen Rodriguez ricicla quello del 2006|publisher=}} In the summer of 2010 Belén posed for the ''Maxim'' glamour calendar for the year 2011. In the autumn of 2010 Belén posed for the ''TIM Glamour Calendar'' for the year 2011; after January 2011, because of her position has host of the [[Sanremo Music Festival 2011|61st Festival of Sanremo]], Belén ended her participation in the calendars. In the summer of 2012, Cecilia, on the advice of Belén and [[Paola Benegas]], posed totally naked for the ''[[For Men]] Calendar 2013'' (published in late 2012 for the year 2013). Between 2004 and 2012, Belén took part as a model in the successful evening events program ''[[Sfilata d'amore e moda]]'', hosted by [[Emanuela Folliero]] on [[Rete 4]]. In the summer of 2009, Belén won acclaim from the Italian public because she posed naked for Number 7 (July/August 2009) of ''[[Playboy Italia]]'' (the Italian edition of ''[[Playboy]]'').{{cite web|url=http://www.softblog.it/post/6486/belen-rodriguez-bellissima-su-playboy|title=Belen Rodriguez bellissima su Playboy Italia|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/galleria/belen-rodriguez-nuda-per-playboy|title=Belen Rodriguez nuda per Playboy|publisher=TVBlog.it}} On 18 February 2009{{cite web|url=http://www.corriere.it/spettacoli/09_febbraio_18/belen_rodriguez_rifatta_seno_cervello_maschio_proietti_c1c60b8c-fd8a-11dd-aa50-00144f02aabc.shtml|title=Belen Rodriguez: mi sono rifatta il seno ma ho un cervello da maschio – Corriere della Sera|publisher=}} Belén declared in an interview with [[Corriere della Sera]] that a few years before she had rejected a proposal to pose nude for the cover of ''[[Playboy Miami]]'', preferring to remain in Italy to pose for a fashion shoot for an Emilian company. In early 2012 Belén became the new face of the lingerie line ''Arthur's Underwear''. In July 2012{{cite web|url=http://video.corriere.it/playboy-usa-sceglie-belen-senza-veli-argentina-pagina-ufficiale-twitter/c3146836-ce69-11e1-9b00-18ac498483bd|title=Playboy Usa sceglie Belen, senza veli l'argentina sulla pagina ufficiale Twitter – Corriere TV|publisher=}} the Italian tabloids reported that{{cite web|url=http://www.liberoquotidiano.it/news/home/1058124/Belen-hot-completamente-nuda-su-Playboy-USA-.html|title=Belen hot completamente nuda su Playboy|publisher=}} the US edition of ''[[Playboy]]'' had plans to contact Belén to pose naked{{cite web|url=http://www.unionesarda.it/fotogallery/fotogallery/2012/07/15/belen_posa_per_playboy_in_usa-18-281092.html|title=Belen posa per Playboy in Usa – Fotogallery – L'Unione Sarda.it|date=15 July 2012|publisher=}} for the cover and centerfold of the August issue, but subsequently this news was denied.{{cite Italian press announced{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/belen-rodriguez-lascia-litalia-victorias-secret-la-chiama-negli-states-82467|title=Belen Rodriguez lascia l'Italia: Victoria's Secret la lingerie brand ''[[Victoria's Secret]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.socialchannel.it/esclusivo-belen-rodriguez-sara-una-degli-angeli-di-victorias-secret/|title=ESCLUSIVO, Belen Rodriguez sara' una degli angeli di Victoria's Secret !? - Social Channel|publisher=}} but it came to nothing. In August 2017[http://www.quotidiano.net/moda/belen-swarovski-1.3351666] Belén became the new worldwide testimonial[https://www.foxlife.it/2017/08/24/belen-testimonial-mondiale-swrovski/] of [[Swarovski]] with [[Alessandra Ambrosio]][http://www.sportfair.it/2017/08/belen-come-naomi-campbell-dal-nuovo-progetto-swarovski-a-iannone-e-de-martino-se-stefano-e-innamorato-io-foto/590643/] and [[Shanina Shaik]].[https://www.foxlife.it/2017/07/31/belen-rodriguez-a-los-angeles-per-swarovski-con-6-milioni-di-follower/] In the spring and summer of 2015 the experience{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.it/fashion/news/15/05/22/belen-rodriguez-2jewels|title=Belén Rodriguez si racconta: dall'ultima campagna per 2Jewels ai nuovi progetti di moda – VanityFair.it|publisher=}} of ''[[Me Fui]]'' was repeated successfully, causing a sensation in the Italian media when [[Paul Marciano]]{{cite web|url=http://www.elle.it/Moda/belen-rodriguez-intervista-testimonial-guess|title=Intervista a Belen Rodriguez|date=19 June 2015|publisher=}} chose Belén as its flagship model and the new worldwide spokesperson for ''[[Guess?]]'' (a role previously entrusted to big international celebrities such as [[Claudia Schiffer]], [[Adriana Lima]], and [[Paris Hilton]]) alongside the spokespersons of that time [[Charlotte McKinney]] and [[Gigi Hadid]]; specifically,{{cite web|url=http://www.verycool.it/2015/10/20/belen-foto-guess-instagram/|title=Belen, le prime foto per Guess su Instagram – Very Cool!|publisher=}} [[Paul Marciano]] chose Belén for the spring–summer of the 2016 season (photo taken in October 2015) and the autumn–winter of the 2016–2017 season (photo taken in April 2016).{{cite web|url=http://www.gossip.it/news/belen-rodriguez-sensuale-shooting-campagna-guess-los-angeles-news.html|title=Belen Rodriguez più sensuale che mai nella nuova campagna Guess a Los Angeles|publisher=}} In the spring–summer of 2016{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/hot/2016/04/04/belen-e-cecilia-il-backstage-delle-sorelle-rodriguez-e-davvero-bollente/|title=Belen e Cecilia, il backstage delle sorelle Rodriguez è davvero bolle...|publisher=}} Belén and Cecilia repeated with success{{cite web|url=http://www.sfilate.it/268950/costumi-cecilia-belen-rodriguez-tornano-fui|title=Costumi: Cecilia e Belen Rodriguez tornano con Me Fui|date=27 May 2016|publisher=}} the experience of ''[[Me Fui]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/spettacoli/belen-e-cecilia-rodriguez-set-bollente-bikini-1263656.html|title=Belen e Cecilia Rodriguez, set bollente in bikini|publisher=}} In February 2017 Belén posed for the women's intimate line and also for the homewear collection of ''[[Jadea]]'' for the spring–summer of 2017.[http://www.oggi.it/moda/tendenze-e-star/2017/02/23/belen-rodriguez-dalla-tutina-al-pigiama-in-casa-si-veste-cosi-guarda-la-testimonial-jadea-in-azione/] In March 2017[http://www.oggi.it/video/gossip/2017/03/31/belen-rodriguez-nel-backstage-e-super-sexy-guarda-il-video-bollente/] Belen became the testimonial[http://www.foreyever.com/it/content/13-vip] of the eyeglass line named ''[[Foreyever]]''. In April 2017 Belén and Cecilia repeated with success the experience of ''[[Me Fui]]'' for the spring–summer of 2017.[http://www.gossip.it/news/belen-rodriguez-pasqua-toscana-shooting-news.html] In July 2017 Belén became the new testimonial[https://www.foxlife.it/2017/07/27/mcdonald-s-i-panini-li-consegna-belen-a-domicilio/] of ''[[McDonald's]]'' and of the new wavy hair plate (named ''Bellissima Beach Waves'')[http://www.beautybiz.it/Marketing/Testimonial/Una-bellissima-per-Bellissima-40538] of ''[[Bellissima Italia]]''.[http://www.mybeautypedia.it/2017/07/come-fare-i-capelli-a-onde-di-belen/][http://www.fashionblog.it/post/520045/onde-belen-rodriguez-con-piastra-la-testimonial-di-bellissima-italia-video-e-foto] In October 2017 Belén became the new testimonal of ''Alessandro Angelozzi Couture'' for the 2018 line of wedding dresses.[http://mag.sky.it/social/2017/10/06/belen-rodriguez-abito-bianco.html] In the Week]]"[https://www.gossip.it/news/belen-rodriguez-andrea-iannone-milano-fashion-week-dedica-news.html] and posed for stir[http://www.dagospia.com/rubrica-2/media_e_tv/mano-ti-sfiori-belen-accarezza-sua-ldquo-farfallina-rdquo-166537.htm] in the Italian media), for the new line of Shaik]]),[https://www.gossip.it/video/belen-rodriguez-tra-bellezze-internazionali-campagna-swarovski-video.html] for the new line of ''[[Jadea]]'' and (with 2018).[https://www.gossip.it/news/cecilia-rodriguez-diventare-imprenditrice-news.html][https://www.gossip.it/news/belen-cecilia-rodriguez-costumi-estate-2018-news.html] In May-July 2018 Belen was model and testimonial of some brand of clothes and jeans like ''RaNpollo'',[https://www.ranpollo.it/it/home] ''Hanny Deep'',[http://www.hannydeep.com/] ''Comme Des
